content:
Studio One是一款数字音频工作站(DAW) 应用程序，用于创建、录制、混合和母带音乐及其他音频，它也可用于视频制作。它由PreSonus开发，适用于macOS和Microsoft Windows系统。除了该软件的商业版本（Studio One Artist和Studio One Professional），PreSonus 还有功能简化的免费版本（Studio One Prime）。专业版也可作为PreSonus Sphere 的一部分被用户每月订阅。

 

历史

早期发展和发行（2004-2011）

Studio One 最初以K2的名义开始发展，作为KRISTAL Audio Engine的后续产品。尽管此后续项目始于 2004 年，但在 2006 年，它成为PreSonus和 KristalLabs Software Ltd.之间的合作项目，后者是由前Steinberg员工 Wolfgang Kundrus 和 Matthias Juwan创立的初创公司。 Kundrus 是Cubase初始版本的开发者之一，并为Nuendo的第一个版本建立了概念。Juwan 是原始KRISTAL Audio Engine 的开发者，编写了VST 插件标准第 3 版的规范，并且还参与了多种Steinberg产品的开发，包括Cubase、Nuendo和HALion。

 

KristalLabs于 2009 年成为PreSonus 的一部分，以前的 KristalLabs 徽标成为 Studio One 徽标的基础。

 

Studio One 1.0于 2009 年 4 月 1 日在Musikmesse 上公开，并于 2009 年 9 月 27 日发布。Studio One 1 (v1.6.5) 的最终更新发布于2011 年 7 月。

 

2.0和3.0 (2011–2018)

Studio One 的第 2 版于 2011 年 10 月 17 日公开，并于 2011 年 10 月 31 日发布（与 2.0.2 更新一起）。此版本引入了多项增强功能，包括与Celemony Melodyne 的集成、瞬态检测和量化、凹槽提取、多轨伴奏、文件夹轨道、多轨MIDI编辑、更新的浏览器和新插件。

 

Studio One 2.0 与Melodyne的集成是通过创建一个名为Audio Random Access (ARA)的新插件扩展来实现的。该扩展由PreSonus和Celemony联合开发，允许音频插件作为应用程序的集成部分出现。

 

Studio One 3.0于 2015 年 5 月 20 日发布。新功能包括编曲轨道、用于创意实验的暂存器、将不同效果和乐器链接在一起的能力、MIDI音符效果、新插件以及在自动化中使用曲线。

 

4.0和5.0（2018 年至今）

继前几周在社交媒体网站上发布的预告图片之后，Studio One 4.0于 2018 年 5 月 22 日通过YouTube 直播活动公开，并同时发布。4.0的新功能包括和弦轨道（带有和弦检测、移调和和弦替换选项）、专用鼓编辑界面、扩展的鼓机和采样器 插件、AAF格式导入/导出功能（与其他 DAW 应用程序交换数据），并支持版本 2ARA插件扩展。

 

几乎整整一年后，即 2019 年 5 月 21 日，随着直播公告和 4.5 版的同步发布，功能得到了进一步扩展。4.5 版引入的新功能包括输入通道增益分级和相位/极性选项、内置插件管理器、M4A ( AAC / ALAC ) 支持、视频导出选项、新分组选项、RMS计量、预推子计量、CPU 多核优化和扩展的宏功能，以及用于批量音频转换和处理的新插件。

 

在 4.6 版本发布之前，PreSonus在伦敦红牛工作室大楼举办了发布会。4.6版于 2019 年 12 月 10 日发布，新功能包括重新设计和扩展的“Ampire”吉他放大器和效果插件（包括新的效果踏板选项）、重新设计的内容浏览器以及用于播客制作的新模板和宏.

 

Studio One 5.0被称为“十年制作的成果”，于2020 年 7 月 7 日通过直播视频发布。这个新版本中添加的功能包括一个完整的乐谱编辑器（具有类似于 PreSonus 的记谱软件的功能） , Notion )，一个“Show”界面，专注于支持现场表演、MIDI 支持增强功能（例如和弦表达、自定义ROLI设备支持，以及使用MTC和MMC将 Studio One 与外部时钟同步的能力）。5.0还增加了对64 位 浮点记录的支持WAV 格式，将录音和处理的最大精度提高到 64 位/384 kHz，从而使 Studio One 成为可用的最高分辨率音频制作和母带制作应用程序之一。

 

特点

标准 DAW 功能

除了其他功能外，Studio One 还包括大多数数字音频工作站软件中常见的基本功能，例如多轨录音机和音频混合控制台中的功能，以及模拟录音无法实现的附加功能（例如撤消之前的操作、不丢失信息的编辑、虚拟仪器的使用等）。

 

版本

Studio One 有 3 个版本，每个版本都有不同的会员费用（如果有）和相应功能。专业版也作为PreSonus Sphere月度订阅计划的一部分提供，该计划还包括其他 PreSonus 软件，例如 Notion，及其所有可用插件。

 

其他功能

Studio One 的其他核心功能包括：

- 具有拖放功能并支持多个屏幕（包括HDPI显示器）的多点触控界面。

- 一个单独的项目级界面，其中包含用于同时对一首或多首歌曲进行母带制作、管理元数据和导出的工具，包括用于创建红皮书标准 CD或磁盘映像（仅限专业版）的选项。

- 一个单独的表演级界面，设计用于从单个位置协调整个现场表演。

- 实时音频时间拉伸功能。

- 集成的乐谱编辑器。

- 轨道和插件的多种自动化模式，包括直线、指数/抛物线、方波、三角波、正弦波等。

- 支持的ARA / ARA2扩展的音频插件，使他们能够紧密结合的应用程序的一部分。

- 一个和弦轨道，可从音频或MIDI轨道自动检测和弦，以及和弦移调和替换选项（仅限专业版）。

- 一个编曲轨道，用于导航歌曲部分并通过拖放重新安排它们。

- 便笺簿，供用户在不影响原始版本的情况下尝试不同的歌曲布局（仅限专业版）。

- 撤消混音过程中的功能，包括插件、虚拟乐器、路由、效果链等。

- 能够创建虚拟乐器和/或效果链（仅限专业版）。

- 支持 MIDI 复音表达/复音压力。

- 支持MTC和MMC，使 Studio One 与外部时钟同步。

- MIDI音符级效果，例如琶音器和和弦发生器。

- 用于编辑编程鼓的专用界面，包括每个音符音高的可配置鼓件名称。

- 混音引擎效果：可用于修改/绕过/替换特定总线/通道的标准混音过程的插件（仅限专业版）。

- 支持用户从其他 DAW 软件切换到键盘快捷键，例如Pro Tools、Logic Pro、Cubase和Sonar。

- 与 Mackie Control 通用通信协议（结合 Mackie Control、Logic Control和HUI的功能）的兼容性，用于与音频控制界面连接。

- 与Native Instruments Komplete Kontrol MkII 系列键盘的兼容性。

 

附加组件

2014 年 1 月随 2.6.2 版一起推出的附加组件是可选项目，由 PreSonus 或第三方开发，可以从 PreSonus 商店单独购买以扩展 Studio One 的功能。这可以包括新功能（通常称为“扩展”）、插件、虚拟乐器预设、循环和其他资产。示例附加功能包括 Audio Batch Converter（与 4.5 版一起发布），它允许同时离线转换和处理多个音频文件，包括使用本机和第三方插件。

 

附加组件也可用于扩展 Studio One Artist，以包含专业版的其他功能，包括VST / AU / ReWire 插件支持、MP3支持和Studio One Remote支持。

 

Studio One Remote

2015 年与 Studio One 3.0 一起推出的 Studio One Remote 是一款应用程序，用于通过连接到同一网络的平板设备无线控制 Studio One 。虽然最初针对Apple iPad发布，但随后发布了针对 Microsoft Windows 和Surface平板电脑（2016 年 2 月）和Android平板电脑（2017 年 6 月）的版本 。它使用PreSonus自己的UCNET协议，该协议用于跨多个PreSonus产品的网络连接和远程控制。

 

可以通过远程控制的 Studio One 功能方面包括：

- 混合控制台，包括插入，发送，输入，输出，和提示混音。

- 走带栏和时间线标尺，包括标记和编曲器部分。

- 跟踪宏控件。

- 插件参数。

 

Studio One Exchange

Studio One Exchange（之前称为 PreSonus Exchange，于 2012 年 1 月与版本 2.0.4一起发布）是一项服务，允许注册的 Studio One 用户交换插件预设、MIDI文件和其他直接从应用程序中获取资源。Studio One 浏览器允许用户浏览、预览、下载和查看其他用户上传到此服务的项目，以及上传自己的项目。

 

重新设计的 Exchange 版本，称为“Exchange 2.0”，于 2019 年 12 月 10 日作为 Studio One v4.6 的一部分发布。

 

获奖

Studio One 自首次发布以来获得了大部分正面评价。被称赞的方面主要包括快速的工作流程、成本效益和可用性。

 

Studio One 在 2011 年、2012 年和 2013 年连续三年获得日本 VGP（视觉大奖赛）“金奖”。

 

2012 年，《Resolution》杂志的读者将 Studio One 2.0评为“DAW”类别的决议奖得主。

 

2013 年，Studio One 2.5 在“最佳录音软件”类别中获得了 MIPA（Musikmesse国际新闻奖）奖。2013 年获得的其他奖项包括 Visual Grand Prix Audio Excellence 奖（“DAW”类别）、ProSoundWeb & Live Sound International、读者选择奖和 Audio Media 的“年度最佳设备”奖，以及来自音乐工作室网站 DAWfreak.se 的 CIF（关注客户）奖。

 

2016 年，Studio One 3.0在NAMM 上荣获 Music and Sound Retailer 颁发的“2015 年最佳多轨录音机/录音和混音软件”奖。
contentEn:
Studio One is a digital audio workstation (DAW) application, used to create, record, mix and master music and other audio, with functionality also available for video. It is developed by PreSonus and available for macOS and Microsoft Windows. In addition to the commercial editions of the software (known as Studio One Artist and Studio One Professional), PreSonus also distributes a free edition, with reduced functionality (known as Studio One Prime). The Professional edition is also available as part of the PreSonus Sphere monthly subscription program.

 

History

Early development and release (2004–2011)

Studio One originally began development under the name K2, as a follow-up to the KRISTAL Audio Engine.[1] Although development for this follow-up began in 2004,[2] it transitioned in 2006 to a cooperation between PreSonus and KristalLabs Software Ltd., a start-up founded by former Steinberg employees Wolfgang Kundrus and Matthias Juwan.[3] Kundrus was one of the developers for initial versions of Cubase, and established concepts for the first version of Nuendo.[4] Juwan was the author of the original KRISTAL Audio Engine, wrote the specification for version 3 of the VST plug-in standard, and had also worked on multiple Steinberg products, including Cubase, Nuendo, and HALion.[5]

 

KristalLabs then became part of PreSonus in 2009,[3] and the former KristalLabs logo was used as the basis for the logo of Studio One.[6]

 

The first version of Studio One was announced on 1 April 2009 at Musikmesse,[7][8] and released on 27 September 2009.[9][10] The final update for Studio One version 1 (v1.6.5) was released in July 2011.[11][12]

 

Versions 2 & 3 (2011–2018)

Version 2 of Studio One was announced on 17 October 2011,[13][14] and released on 31 October 2011 (alongside the 2.0.2 update).[15] This release of the software introduced multiple enhancements, including integration with Celemony Melodyne, transient detection & quantization, groove extraction, multi-track comping, folder tracks, multi-track MIDI editing, an updated browser, and new plug-ins.[16]

 

The integration of Studio One version 2 with Melodyne was achieved via the creation of a new plug-in extension, known as Audio Random Access (ARA). This extension, developed jointly by PreSonus and Celemony, allows an audio plug-in to appear as an integrated part of the application.[17]

 

Version 3 of Studio One was released on 20 May 2015.[18] The new features included an arranger track, scratchpads for idea experimentation, the ability to chain together different effects and instruments, MIDI note effects, new plug-ins, and the ability to use curves in automation.[19]

 

Versions 4 & 5 (2018–present)

Following teaser images on social media websites in the preceding weeks,[20] version 4 of Studio One was announced via a YouTube live stream event on 22 May 2018, and released simultaneously.[21][22] New features in version 4 included a chord track (with chord detection, transposition and chord substitution options), a dedicated drum editing interface, expanded drum machine & sampler plug-ins, AAF-format import/export functionality (to exchange data with other DAW applications), and support for version 2 of the ARA plug-in extension.[22]

 

Almost exactly a year later, on 21 May 2019, this functionality was expanded further with the live stream announcement and simultaneous release of version 4.5.[23] New functionality introduced with version 4.5 included input channel gain staging and phase/polarity options, a built-in plug-in manager, M4A (AAC/ALAC) support, video export options, new grouping options, RMS metering, pre-fader metering, CPU multi-core optimization, and expanded macro features, alongside a new add-on for batch audio conversion & processing.[24][25]

 

The release of version 4.6 was preceded by a launch party event, hosted by PreSonus at the Red Bull Studios building in London.[26] Its release on 10 December 2019 included a re-designed and expanded version of the 'Ampire' guitar amplifier and effects plugin (including new effects pedal options), a re-designed content browser, and new templates & macros for podcast production.[27][28]

 

Version 5 of Studio One, described as "ten years in the making", was announced via live-stream video on 7 July 2020. Features added in this new version included a full score editor (with features similar to that of PreSonus' notation software, Notion), a 'Show’ interface focused on supporting live performances, MIDI support enhancements (such as polyphonic expression, custom ROLI device support, and the ability to use MTC & MMC to synchronize Studio One with external clocks). Version 5 also added support for recording in 64-bit floating-point WAV format, bringing the maximum precision for recording & processing to 64-bit/384 kHz and thereby making Studio One one of the highest-resolution audio production and mastering applications available.[29][30][31]

 

Features

Standard DAW Features

Main article: Digital audio workstation

In addition to its other functionality, Studio One includes fundamental features which are common across most digital audio workstation software, such as the functionality found in multi-track recorders and audio mixing consoles, plus additional functions not possible with analog recording (such as undoing previous actions, editing without loss of information, use of virtual instruments, etc.).[32]

 

Editions

Studio One is available in 3 editions, each with a different license cost (if any) and set of features. The Professional edition is also available as part of the PreSonus Sphere monthly subscription program, which also includes other PreSonus software, such as Notion, and all of its available plug-ins.[33]

 

Other Features

The other core features of Studio One include the following:

  • A multi-touch interface with drag-and-drop functionality and support for multiple screens, including HDPI displays.[19]
  • A separate Project-level interface, which contains tools for mastering, managing the metadata of, and exporting one or more songs simultaneously, including options for creating Red Book Standard CDs or disk images (Professional Edition only).[47]
  • A separate Show-level interface, designed for use in coordinating the entirety of live performances from a single location.[48]
  • Real-time audio time-stretching features.[49]
  • Integrated music score editor.[29]
  • Multiple automation patterns for tracks and plug-ins, including straight lines, exponential/parabolic curves, square waves, triangle waves, sine waves, etc.[50]
  • Support for the ARA/ARA2 extension for audio plug-ins, allowing them to closely integrate as part of the application.[17]
  • A chord track, with automatic chord detection from audio or MIDI tracks, and options for chord transposition and substitution (Professional Edition only).[22]
  • An arranger track, for navigating song sections and re-arranging them via drag-and-drop.[19]
  • Scratch pads, for users to experiment with different song layouts without impacting the original version (Professional Edition only).[19]
  • Undo functionality across the mixing process, including for plug-ins, virtual instruments, routing, effects chains, and others.[51]
  • The ability to create chains of virtual instruments and/or effects (Professional Edition only).[19]
  • Support for MIDI Polyphonic Expression / Poly Pressure.[29]
  • Support for MTC and MMC, to synchronize Studio One with external clocks.[31]
  • MIDI note-level effects, such as an arpeggiator and a chord generator.[19]
  • A dedicated interface for editing programmed drums, including configurable kit piece names for each note pitch.[22]
  • Mix Engine effects: plug-ins that can be used to modify/bypass/replace the standard mixing processes for a specific bus/channel (Professional Edition only).[52]
  • Support for users to switch to the keyboard shortcuts from other DAW software, such as Pro Tools, Logic Pro, Cubase, and Sonar.[53][54]
  • Compatibility with the Mackie Control Universal communications protocol (which combines functionality from Mackie Control, Logic Control and HUI[55]), for interfacing with audio control surfaces.[56][57]
  • Compatibility with Native Instruments Komplete Kontrol MkII series keyboards.[58]

 

Add-Ons

Introduced with version 2.6.2 in January 2014, add-ons are optional items, developed either by PreSonus, or by third-parties, which can be acquired separately from the PreSonus store to expand the capabilities of Studio One. This can include new functionality (often known as 'extensions'), plug-ins, virtual instrument presets, loops, and other assets.[45] Example add-on functionality includes the Audio Batch Converter (released alongside version 4.5), which allows for the offline conversion and processing of multiple audio files simultaneously, including the use of both native and third-party plug-ins.[46]

 

Add-ons are also available to expand Studio One Artist to include other functionality from the Professional edition, including VST/AU/ReWire plug-in support, MP3 support, and Studio One Remote support.[45][36]

 

Studio One Remote

Introduced alongside Studio One version 3 in 2015, Studio One Remote is an app for wirelessly controlling Studio One via a tablet device connected to the same network.[43] Whilst originally released for the Apple iPad, Remote was subsequently released for Microsoft Windows & Surface tablets (February 2016),[59] and for Android tablets (June 2017).[60] It uses PreSonus' own UCNET protocol, which is used for network connectivity and remote control across multiple PreSonus products.[43]

 

Aspects of Studio One functionality which can be controlled via Remote include:[43]

  • The mixing console, including inserts, sends, inputs, outputs, and cue mixes.
  • The transport bar and timeline ruler, including markers and arranger sections.
  • Track macro controls.
  • Plug-in parameters.

 

Studio One Exchange

Studio One Exchange (previously known as PreSonus Exchange when it was first released in January 2012, alongside version 2.0.4[61][62]) is a service which allows registered Studio One users to exchange plug-in presets, MIDI files and other resources from directly within the application.[63] The Studio One Browser allows users to explore, preview, download, and review items uploaded to this service by other users, as well as upload their own.[64]

 

A re-designed version of Exchange, referred to as 'Exchange 2.0' was released as part of Studio One v4.6 on 10 December 2019.[27]

 

Reception

Studio One has received mostly positive reviews since its initial release. Common areas of praise include rapid workflow, cost-effectiveness, and usability.[19][65][66][67][68][69]

 

Studio One won the Japanese V.G.P. (Visual Grand Prix) 'Gold' award for three consecutive years, in 2011, 2012, and 2013.[70]

 

In 2012, readers of Resolution Magazine named Studio One (version 2) as the Resolution Award winner in the 'DAW' category.[71][72]

 

In 2013, Studio One (version 2.5) won a M.I.P.A. (Musikmesse International Press Awards) award in the 'Best Recording Software' category.[73][74] Other awards received in 2013 included the Visual Grand Prix Audio Excellence award (in the 'DAW' category), the ProSoundWeb & Live Sound International, Readers’ Choice Award, and Audio Media's 'Gear of the Year' award, and the C.I.F. (Customers in Focus) award from the music studio website DAWfreak.se.[75][76][77][78][79][80]

 

In 2016, Studio One (version 3) won Music and Sound Retailer's award for 'Best Multitrack Recorder/Recording & Mixing Software of 2015' at NAMM.[81][82]

 

References

  2. ^ "KRISTAL 2 – The Future". KRISTAL User Community. Retrieved 16 April 2018.

  10. ^ Jump up to:a b Lassen, Justin (8 January 2010). "PreSonus Studio One". Studio Daily. Retrieved 22 May2019.
  11. ^ Jump up to:a b "PreSonus and Lion". Sweetwater inSync. 27 July 2011. Retrieved 22 May 2019.

  15. ^ Jump up to:a b "PreSonus Studio One 2.0.2 Update Released". PreSonus. 31 October 2011. Retrieved 15 March 2018.
  16. ^ Jump up to:a b "PreSonus Studio One v2 Integrates Melodyne – Can Your DAW Do This?". Synthtopia. 19 October 2011. Retrieved 11 April 2018.
  17. ^ Jump up to:a b Rogerson, Ben (18 October 2011). "Celemony explains ARA: new VST/AU/RTAS plug-in extension". MusicRadar. Retrieved 10 April 2018.
  18. ^ Jump up to:a b "PreSonus Unveils Studio One 3". Sweetwater inSync. 20 May 2015. Retrieved 22 May2019.
  19. ^ Jump up to:a b c d e f g h Vincent, Robin. "PreSonus Studio One 3". Sound On Sound. Retrieved 10 April2018.

remarks:
本词条汉字内容由 @多频百科团队 翻译+编辑
原文译自 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studio_One_(software)
name: Studio One
descriptions: Studio One是一款数字音频工作站(DAW) 应用程序，用于创建、录制、混合和母带音乐及其他音频，它也可用于视频制作。它由PreSonus开发，适用于macOS和Microsoft Windows系统。除了该软件的商业版本（Studio One Artist和Studio One Professional），PreSonus 还有功能简化的免费版本（Studio One Prime）。专业版也可作为PreSonus Sphere 的一部分被用户每月订阅。
